nodes.bodyText:
This is not consistent with the other assignments where the value of the parameter is not checked.
Either check the value everywhere or do not check here.

You should merge the 4 ifs to only have 2 ifs, removing in the process the forced* variables.
Also getting the default values is unnecessary.
Merge ifs, see comment for DELETE.
Can thrown NPE if the configuration is not set and expecting default.
Same remark as for EgressFetchHandler, either check for value of not.
Default not used, can be initialized to false.
Default not used, can be initialized to false.
Default not used, can be initialized to false.
Default not used, can be initialized to false.
In DELETE, FETCH and UPDATE, the test is Boolean.TRUE.equals so for coherency it should be "true".equals and switch if/else.
In DELETE, FETCH and UPDATE, the test is Boolean.TRUE.equals so for coherency it should be "true".equals and switch if/else.
In DELETE, FETCH and UPDATE, the test is Boolean.TRUE.equals so for coherency it should be "true".equals.

The reason why we are checking if the attribute is "false" is because prior to this PR the attribute was simply set to the empty string to specify that it was true, not to 'true', so in order to remain backward compatible with DatalogRequests which might still be buffered, we check if the attribute is "false" and negate the test.
In DELETE, FETCH and UPDATE, the test is Boolean.TRUE.equals so for coherency it should be "true".equals.
